Description: Carved and painted wooden shabti of 3st, Chantress of Amun with a black lappet-wig, a crudely modelled face with black eyebrows and a red and blue collar; the hands are unmarked; the body is white(worn); the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
